import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Handle missing values and convert numeric columns
numeric_columns = ['AminerCitationCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'PubsCited_CrossRef', 'Downloads_Xplore']
for col in numeric_columns:
    df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors='coerce')

# Handle keywords
# Split keywords by comma or semicolon, normalize case, and strip whitespace
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
keywords_series = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.split('[,;]', expand=True).stack().str.strip().str.lower()

# Count keyword frequencies
keyword_counts = Counter(keywords_series)

# Convert to DataFrame for easier plotting
keyword_df = pd.DataFrame(keyword_counts.items(), columns=['Keyword', 'Count'])
keyword_df = keyword_df.sort_values(by='Count', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='Count', y='Keyword', data=keyword_df.head(10), palette='viridis')
plt.title('Top 10 Most Common Keywords in Visualization for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Frequency')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

# Correlate keywords with citation counts
# Create a DataFrame to store keyword and average citation count
keyword_citation_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Keyword', 'AverageCitationCount'])

# Calculate average citation count for each keyword
for keyword in keyword_df['Keyword']:
    keyword_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains(keyword, case=False, na=False)]
    avg_citation_count = keyword_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean()
    keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.append({'Keyword': keyword, 'AverageCitationCount': avg_citation_count}, ignore_index=True)

# Sort by average citation count
keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.sort_values(by='AverageCitationCount', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords by average citation count
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='AverageCitationCount', y='Keyword', data=keyword_citation_df.head(10), palette='magma')
plt.title('Top 10 Keywords by Average Citation Count')
plt.xlabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# Print the top 10 keywords and their average citation counts
print(keyword_citation_df.head(10))
### End of facts

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect the data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Convert 'Year' to integer, handle errors
# Convert 'CitationCount_CrossRef' to numeric, handle errors
df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce')
df['CitationCount_CrossRef'] = pd.to_numeric(df['CitationCount_CrossRef'], errors='coerce')

# Handle missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Extract keywords and normalize them
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
df['Keywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(',|;| and ')

# Flatten the keywords and associate them with years and citation counts
keywords_trends = df.explode('Keywords')[['Year', 'Keywords', 'CitationCount_CrossRef']]

# Filter for specific visualization techniques
techniques = ['bicluster', 'graph-based visualization']
keywords_trends = keywords_trends[keywords_trends['Keywords'].str.contains('|'.join(techniques))]

# Group by year and keyword, then calculate average citation count
trends = keywords_trends.groupby(['Year', 'Keywords']).agg(
    count=('Keywords', 'size'),
    avg_citation=('CitationCount_CrossRef', 'mean')
).reset_index()

# Plot the trends over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='count', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot the average citation count over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='avg_citation', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Average Citation Count for Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# The code will output two plots:
# 1. Trends in the number of papers using specific visualization techniques over the years.
# 2. Trends in the average citation count of papers using these techniques over the years.
### End of facts

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Handle missing values and convert numeric columns
numeric_columns = ['AminerCitationCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'PubsCited_CrossRef', 'Downloads_Xplore']
for col in numeric_columns:
    df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors='coerce')

# Handle keywords
# Split keywords by comma or semicolon, normalize case, and strip whitespace
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
keywords_series = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.split('[,;]', expand=True).stack().str.strip().str.lower()

# Count keyword frequencies
keyword_counts = Counter(keywords_series)

# Convert to DataFrame for easier plotting
keyword_df = pd.DataFrame(keyword_counts.items(), columns=['Keyword', 'Count'])
keyword_df = keyword_df.sort_values(by='Count', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='Count', y='Keyword', data=keyword_df.head(10), palette='viridis')
plt.title('Top 10 Most Common Keywords in Visualization for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Frequency')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

# Correlate keywords with citation counts
# Create a DataFrame to store keyword and average citation count
keyword_citation_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Keyword', 'AverageCitationCount'])

# Calculate average citation count for each keyword
for keyword in keyword_df['Keyword']:
    keyword_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains(keyword, case=False, na=False)]
    avg_citation_count = keyword_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean()
    keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.append({'Keyword': keyword, 'AverageCitationCount': avg_citation_count}, ignore_index=True)

# Sort by average citation count
keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.sort_values(by='AverageCitationCount', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords by average citation count
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='AverageCitationCount', y='Keyword', data=keyword_citation_df.head(10), palette='magma')
plt.title('Top 10 Keywords by Average Citation Count')
plt.xlabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# Print the top 10 keywords and their average citation counts
print(keyword_citation_df.head(10))
### End of facts

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect the data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Convert 'Year' to integer, handle errors
# Convert 'CitationCount_CrossRef' to numeric, handle errors
df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce')
df['CitationCount_CrossRef'] = pd.to_numeric(df['CitationCount_CrossRef'], errors='coerce')

# Handle missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Extract keywords and normalize them
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
df['Keywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(',|;| and ')

# Flatten the keywords and associate them with years and citation counts
keywords_trends = df.explode('Keywords')[['Year', 'Keywords', 'CitationCount_CrossRef']]

# Filter for specific visualization techniques
techniques = ['bicluster', 'graph-based visualization']
keywords_trends = keywords_trends[keywords_trends['Keywords'].str.contains('|'.join(techniques))]

# Group by year and keyword, then calculate average citation count
trends = keywords_trends.groupby(['Year', 'Keywords']).agg(
    count=('Keywords', 'size'),
    avg_citation=('CitationCount_CrossRef', 'mean')
).reset_index()

# Plot the trends over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='count', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot the average citation count over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='avg_citation', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Average Citation Count for Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# The code will output two plots:
# 1. Trends in the number of papers using specific visualization techniques over the years.
# 2. Trends in the average citation count of papers using these techniques over the years.
### End of facts

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Handle missing values and convert numeric columns
numeric_columns = ['AminerCitationCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'PubsCited_CrossRef', 'Downloads_Xplore']
for col in numeric_columns:
    df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors='coerce')

# Handle keywords
# Split keywords by comma or semicolon, normalize case, and strip whitespace
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
keywords_series = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.split('[,;]', expand=True).stack().str.strip().str.lower()

# Count keyword frequencies
keyword_counts = Counter(keywords_series)

# Convert to DataFrame for easier plotting
keyword_df = pd.DataFrame(keyword_counts.items(), columns=['Keyword', 'Count'])
keyword_df = keyword_df.sort_values(by='Count', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='Count', y='Keyword', data=keyword_df.head(10), palette='viridis')
plt.title('Top 10 Most Common Keywords in Visualization for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Frequency')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

# Correlate keywords with citation counts
# Create a DataFrame to store keyword and average citation count
keyword_citation_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Keyword', 'AverageCitationCount'])

# Calculate average citation count for each keyword
for keyword in keyword_df['Keyword']:
    keyword_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains(keyword, case=False, na=False)]
    avg_citation_count = keyword_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean()
    keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.append({'Keyword': keyword, 'AverageCitationCount': avg_citation_count}, ignore_index=True)

# Sort by average citation count
keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.sort_values(by='AverageCitationCount', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords by average citation count
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='AverageCitationCount', y='Keyword', data=keyword_citation_df.head(10), palette='magma')
plt.title('Top 10 Keywords by Average Citation Count')
plt.xlabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# Print the top 10 keywords and their average citation counts
print(keyword_citation_df.head(10))
### End of facts

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect the data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Convert 'Year' to integer, handle errors
# Convert 'CitationCount_CrossRef' to numeric, handle errors
df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce')
df['CitationCount_CrossRef'] = pd.to_numeric(df['CitationCount_CrossRef'], errors='coerce')

# Handle missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Extract keywords and normalize them
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
df['Keywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(',|;| and ')

# Flatten the keywords and associate them with years and citation counts
keywords_trends = df.explode('Keywords')[['Year', 'Keywords', 'CitationCount_CrossRef']]

# Filter for specific visualization techniques
techniques = ['bicluster', 'graph-based visualization']
keywords_trends = keywords_trends[keywords_trends['Keywords'].str.contains('|'.join(techniques))]

# Group by year and keyword, then calculate average citation count
trends = keywords_trends.groupby(['Year', 'Keywords']).agg(
    count=('Keywords', 'size'),
    avg_citation=('CitationCount_CrossRef', 'mean')
).reset_index()

# Plot the trends over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='count', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot the average citation count over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='avg_citation', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Average Citation Count for Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# The code will output two plots:
# 1. Trends in the number of papers using specific visualization techniques over the years.
# 2. Trends in the average citation count of papers using these techniques over the years.
### End of facts

import seaborn as sns
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Handle missing values and convert numeric columns
numeric_columns = ['AminerCitationCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'PubsCited_CrossRef', 'Downloads_Xplore']
for col in numeric_columns:
    df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors='coerce')

# Handle keywords
# Split keywords by comma or semicolon, normalize case, and strip whitespace
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
keywords_series = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.split('[,;]', expand=True).stack().str.strip().str.lower()

# Count keyword frequencies
keyword_counts = Counter(keywords_series)

# Convert to DataFrame for easier plotting

plt.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect the data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Convert 'Year' to integer, handle errors
# Convert 'CitationCount_CrossRef' to numeric, handle errors
df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce')
df['CitationCount_CrossRef'] = pd.to_numeric(df['CitationCount_CrossRef'], errors='coerce')

# Handle missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Extract keywords and normalize them
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
df['Keywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(',|;| and ')

# Flatten the keywords and associate them with years and citation counts
keywords_trends = df.explode('Keywords')[['Year', 'Keywords', 'CitationCount_CrossRef']]

# Filter for specific visualization techniques
techniques = ['bicluster', 'graph-based visualization']
keywords_trends = keywords_trends[keywords_trends['Keywords'].str.contains('|'.join(techniques))]

# Group by year and keyword, then calculate average citation count
trends = keywords_trends.groupby(['Year', 'Keywords']).agg(
    count=('Keywords', 'size'),
    avg_citation=('CitationCount_CrossRef', 'mean')
).reset_index()

# Plot the trends over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='count', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot the average citation count over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='avg_citation', hue='Keywords', marker='o')

plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

### Begin of facts

# 1. Trends in the number of papers using specific visualization techniques over the years.
# 2. Trends in the average citation count of papers using these techniques over the years.
### End of facts

question.question: What are the most common keywords used by authors in papers related to visualization for sensemaking, and how do these keywords correlate with the citation counts of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
from collections import Counter

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Handle missing values and convert numeric columns
numeric_columns = ['AminerCitationCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef', 'PubsCited_CrossRef', 'Downloads_Xplore']
for col in numeric_columns:
    df[col] = pd.to_numeric(df[col], errors='coerce')

# Handle keywords
# Split keywords by comma or semicolon, normalize case, and strip whitespace
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
keywords_series = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.split('[,;]', expand=True).stack().str.strip().str.lower()

# Count keyword frequencies
keyword_counts = Counter(keywords_series)

# Convert to DataFrame for easier plotting
keyword_df = pd.DataFrame(keyword_counts.items(), columns=['Keyword', 'Count'])
keyword_df = keyword_df.sort_values(by='Count', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='Count', y='Keyword', data=keyword_df.head(10), palette='viridis')
plt.title('Top 10 Most Common Keywords in Visualization for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Frequency')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

# Correlate keywords with citation counts
# Create a DataFrame to store keyword and average citation count
keyword_citation_df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Keyword', 'AverageCitationCount'])

# Calculate average citation count for each keyword
for keyword in keyword_df['Keyword']:
    keyword_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains(keyword, case=False, na=False)]
    avg_citation_count = keyword_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'].mean()
    keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.append({'Keyword': keyword, 'AverageCitationCount': avg_citation_count}, ignore_index=True)

# Sort by average citation count
keyword_citation_df = keyword_citation_df.sort_values(by='AverageCitationCount', ascending=False)

# Plot top 10 keywords by average citation count
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(x='AverageCitationCount', y='Keyword', data=keyword_citation_df.head(10), palette='magma')
plt.title('Top 10 Keywords by Average Citation Count')
plt.xlabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.ylabel('Keyword')
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# Print the top 10 keywords and their average citation counts
print(keyword_citation_df.head(10))
### End of facts

question.question: What are the trends in the use of specific visualization techniques (e.g., biclusters, graph-based visualization) over the years in the dataset, and how do these trends correlate with the citation counts of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
path = 'outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250816_160520/dataset_selected.csv'
df = pd.read_csv(path, delimiter=',')

# Inspect the data types and initial rows
df.info()
print(df.head())

# Convert 'Year' to integer, handle errors
# Convert 'CitationCount_CrossRef' to numeric, handle errors
df['Year'] = pd.to_numeric(df['Year'], errors='coerce')
df['CitationCount_CrossRef'] = pd.to_numeric(df['CitationCount_CrossRef'], errors='coerce')

# Handle missing values
df = df.dropna(subset=['Year', 'CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Extract keywords and normalize them
df['AuthorKeywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].fillna('')
df['Keywords'] = df['AuthorKeywords'].str.lower().str.split(',|;| and ')

# Flatten the keywords and associate them with years and citation counts
keywords_trends = df.explode('Keywords')[['Year', 'Keywords', 'CitationCount_CrossRef']]

# Filter for specific visualization techniques
techniques = ['bicluster', 'graph-based visualization']
keywords_trends = keywords_trends[keywords_trends['Keywords'].str.contains('|'.join(techniques))]

# Group by year and keyword, then calculate average citation count
trends = keywords_trends.groupby(['Year', 'Keywords']).agg(
    count=('Keywords', 'size'),
    avg_citation=('CitationCount_CrossRef', 'mean')
).reset_index()

# Plot the trends over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='count', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Trends in Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Number of Papers')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Plot the average citation count over the years
plt.figure(figsize=(14, 7))
sns.lineplot(data=trends, x='Year', y='avg_citation', hue='Keywords', marker='o')
plt.title('Average Citation Count for Visualization Techniques Over the Years')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Average Citation Count')
plt.legend(title='Visualization Technique')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

### Begin of facts
# The code will output two plots:
# 1. Trends in the number of papers using specific visualization techniques over the years.
# 2. Trends in the average citation count of papers using these techniques over the years.
### End of facts
